Talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_00>The two of us aren't tough enough in
a scrap to send those monsters packing.<sp:0:4:0>What we need is a <clr:0000>bodyguard<clr:ffff> with some
muscle to stand watch over the crops...
Talk_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_01>Our veggies and fields are the real jewels
of Hateno Village. <sp:5:0:0>We're lucky to have you
around protecting them. <sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>We'll just get Cece's approval on them
real quick, and then we can start selling
them as Hateno's signature produce.
Talk_45:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Wakeup_00>Hey there! <sp:5:0:0>Who's come to visit me out
in the field? <sp:5:0:0>Oh.
Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Based on our stakeouts, the monsters
come <clr:0000>late at night<clr:ffff> and seem to go back
where they came from <clr:0000>when the sun rises<clr:ffff>.
Talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_01>I can't let a traveler stand against those
monsters alone. I'll be there fighting right
beside you!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>Or I'll try, at least. But if the monsters are
too much for us and I can't take the heat,
I hope you won't blame me for <clr:0000>retreating<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I know this is short notice, but I'm set to
go if you are. Ready to hold this field with
me until dawn?
Talk_47:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_00>'Ello there. <sp:5:0:0>I'm mighty sorry for getting
you wrapped up in this.
Talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_00>If nothing changes, those <clr:0000>monsters <clr:ffff>will
have the run of the place every night.
And I worry they won't stop with veggies.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>What we need is a <clr:0000>bodyguard<clr:ffff> with some
muscle to stand watch over the crops...
Talk_48:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Angry>I'll leave this up to you and Mayor Reede.
Sure, my field's important to me, but I
need to think of my home and family too.
Talk_20: <sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>Are you ready to fend off the monsters?
Talk_50:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00>Aw, rats. <sp:5:0:0>I went to all that trouble to raise
them from seeds, and now this.
Talk_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:SurpriseS_01>Well, what do you know! <sp:5:0:0>The monsters
left along with the dawn. <sp:5:0:0>My vegetable
field is saved!
Talk_53:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>If these <clr:0000>monsters<clr:ffff> can have their way with
our fields, who's to say they won't get
bolder and start attacking villagers?<sp:0:4:0>We have to put a stop to their
raids somehow.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>I'll help, of course! Can't expect a traveler
to protect our fields alone.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Then again...if the monsters rough me up
and I can't take any more, you'll excuse
me if I <clr:0000>retreat<clr:ffff>, I hope.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Are you ready? Should we start our
stakeout until the monsters show up?
Talk_24:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Chat_01>Thanks to you, the pumpkins we worked
so hard on got the chance to grow.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0300>Aren't these pumpkins beautiful? See the
way they catch the sunlight and sparkle?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL_01>That's it! <sp:5:0:0>We should call these beauties
<clr:0000>sun pumpkins<clr:ffff>!<sp:0:4:0>Plump, delicious <clr:0000>sun pumpkins<clr:ffff>... <sp:5:1:0>Yeah.<sp:5:0:0>
I think that's the perfect name for them.
Talk_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>None of this would have been possible
without you looking out for us.
Talk_55:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm usually glad for the rain. It's good for
the crops, after all. But what's the point
when monsters will just trash it again?
Talk_26:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Scare_00>Urp... <sp:5:0:0>I wasn't expecting to have to fight
this many monsters. <sp:5:0:0>S...<sp:5:0:0>save me!
Talk_28: <sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Unconscious_01>I...<sp:5:0:0>can't go on... <sp:5:0:0>It's all up to you now.
Talk_29:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_01>Aww, that's a shame. <sp:5:0:0>We just weren't up
to the job tonight.
Talk_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>The monsters will just keep coming unless
we can make a real dent in 'em.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>But we'll get other chances. I hope you'll
be there next time too.
Talk_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Had other things in mind for today, eh?
Well, just let me know when you're ready.
Talk_31:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_01>Oof...<sp:5:0:0>the monsters sure whipped our
hides but good.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>But we can't give up!
Talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0201><snd:TalkPositive_00>Great! Then let's stay here and keep our
eyes peeled for monsters.
Talk_32:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_01>Tonight's the night we'll protect this field
from those low-down monsters!
Talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseL_01>Th-this is about the time that monsters
usually come to lay waste to the field.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>When you see them get near the field,
send 'em packing!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Sad_00>I don't think the monsters like it when
dawn breaks, so we've just gotta hold out
until <clr:0000>the sun rises<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM_01>Th...<sp:5:0:0>they're coming! <sp:5:0:0>Please, Link! <sp:5:0:0>Help!
Talk_33:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseL_00>Hey! Where are you going?! Are we
making a strategic retreat?!
Talk_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>We've beaten so many monsters already
that there can't be any more coming.<sp:5:0:0>
You did it, Link!<sp:0:4:0>No need to wait for sunrise to know
it's over.
Talk_35: <sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Greeting_01>Here. This is our thanks for your help.
Talk_40:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseL_01>All right, I guess we're retreating for now!
Let's get to safety and come up with
a new plan.
Talk_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_00>Oh, hi there. I still owe you one after the
mayoral election.<sp:0:4:0>I'm going to let you in on a little secret.<sp:0:4:0>I've been doing some research toward
a test run of veggies using some Cece-
brand style.
Talk_41:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_01>That was a lot more monsters than I was
expecting.
Talk_13:
<sp:3:0:2:0201><snd:Angry_01>The two of us worked hard raising them.
They were almost ready for the harvest.<sp:0:4:0>But then a pack of <clr:0000>monsters <clr:ffff>came and
trashed the fields, so the whole crop
is ruined.
